modules.description: This module implements a DNS server that processes queries using zone data loaded from files or buffers. It provides functions to create a server instance, load zone data, and serve DNS records on a specified port using MirageOS-compatible networking and storage. Concrete use cases include hosting DNS zones from static files in unikernel-based network services.

Resolves DNS queries for `.local` domains and link-local IP addresses using a specified local resolver, while forwarding other queries to a secondary resolver. It operates on DNS packets and IP addresses, providing functions to resolve hostnames and IP addresses with customizable DNS server settings. This module is useful for implementing hybrid DNS resolution in networked applications that handle both local and global domain lookups.

This module implements mDNS-based DNS resolution with functions to create a resolver instance and perform DNS queries asynchronously. It operates on network stacks and IP addresses, supporting standard DNS operations like name-to-address and address-to-name lookups. It is used to resolve hostnames in local networks using multicast DNS, such as discovering services or devices without a centralized DNS server.

This module implements a static DNS resolver for MirageOS, providing functions to perform DNS queries using a predefined configuration. It supports A record lookups via `gethostbyname` and reverse lookups via `gethostbyaddr`, returning resolved IP addresses or hostnames. The resolver operates over a MirageOS network stack and uses Lwt for asynchronous I/O operations.

This module implements DNS resolution for MirageOS by handling queries to resolve domain names to IP addresses and vice versa. It works with network stacks and time modules to perform asynchronous DNS lookups using specified servers and ports. Concrete use cases include resolving hostnames during network connection setup or retrieving domain names from IP addresses for logging and diagnostics.

This module implements a static DNS resolver for MirageOS, enabling A record lookups with `gethostbyname` and reverse lookups with `gethostbyaddr`. It uses predefined mappings stored in standard hashtables for name-to-IP and IP-to-name resolution. The resolver integrates with MirageOS network stacks and performs asynchronous I/O using Lwt.

The module defines a server-side DNS interface for handling DNS queries and responses. It includes functions for processing incoming DNS packets, managing zone records, and generating appropriate replies. This module is used to implement DNS servers that can respond to domain name resolution requests based on predefined or dynamic zone data.

This module implements DNS resolution over multicast DNS (mDNS) for service discovery and hostname resolution in local networks. It provides a `Client` module for initiating mDNS queries, handling responses, and resolving hostnames to IP addresses. The module works with IPv4 addresses and DNS resource records, enabling direct integration into network applications requiring zero-configuration discovery.
